ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To provide users with customizable, animated companion overlays on their desktop for entertainment and personalization.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Add pets (45+ available, plus custom options) â€¢ Remove pets â€¢ Pixel perfect drag and drop â€¢ Click through pets â€¢ Auto start up
ðŸ“– Summary: WindowPet is a cross-platform desktop application that allows users to place animated pets and characters as overlays on their screen. Built with Tauri and React, it offers customization options, click-through functionality, and efficient performance for a delightful user experience.

ðŸŒŸ CloudRip | Python
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Finding the origin IP addresses of websites protected by Cloudflare for penetration testing and security research.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ IPv4 & IPv6 support â€¢ Multiple IPs detection â€¢ Progress bar with live stats â€¢ Dynamic Cloudflare IP detection â€¢ Fast subdomain scanning using multiple threads
ðŸ“– Summary: CloudRip is a Python-based cybersecurity tool designed to uncover the real IP addresses of websites protected by Cloudflare. It achieves this by systematically checking subdomains and filtering out Cloudflare's proxy IPs, making it useful for penetration testing and security research.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸš€ plainpad | PHP
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: A personal, self-hosted note-taking application for users who want to own and control their data.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Self-hosted note taking application â€¢ User ownership of data â€¢ PHP and React based â€¢ Simple and stable design
ðŸ“– Summary: Plainpad is a self-hosted note-taking application built with PHP and React, offering users ownership of their data by running on their own server. It prioritizes simplicity and stability for personal knowledge management.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸŒŸ mtlog | Go
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Providing a powerful, efficient, and flexible structured logging solution for Go applications, enabling better observability and debugging.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Zero-allocation logging â€¢ Message templates with Go template syntax support â€¢ OpenTelemetry compatibility â€¢ Structured fields via With() method â€¢ Output templates for customizable formatting
ðŸ“– Summary: mtlog is a high-performance structured logging library for Go, inspired by Serilog. It offers zero-allocation logging, message templates, OpenTelemetry compatibility, and a pipeline architecture for flexible log management. It also includes HTTP middleware for request/response logging and supports various sinks like Console, File, Seq, Elasticsearch, and Splunk.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project â€¢ Homepage ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

ðŸ’¡ moss-kernel | Rust
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: Developing and running a modern, safe, and Linux-compatible operating system kernel in Rust.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Rust-based kernel for Aarch64 â€¢ Linux-compatible userspace (BusyBox) â€¢ Asynchronous core using async/await â€¢ Modular architecture abstraction layer â€¢ Memory Management (MMU, CoW, page fault handling)
ðŸ“– Summary: Moss is a Unix-like, Linux-compatible kernel written in Rust for the Aarch64 architecture. It leverages Rust's async/await features for a modern, deadlock-free kernel design and aims for binary compatibility with Linux userspace, capable of running BusyBox commands.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source

âœ¨ GhidraGPT | Java
ðŸŽ¯ Primary Use Case: To enhance reverse engineering workflows by leveraging LLMs for automated code analysis, rewriting, and explanation within the Ghidra environment.
âœ¨ Key Features: â€¢ Function Rewrite (renaming, type inference, comments) â€¢ Code Explanation â€¢ Vulnerability Detection â€¢ Context Menu Integration â€¢ Console Interface
ðŸ“– Summary: GhidraGPT is a Ghidra plugin that integrates Large Language Models (LLMs) to automate and enhance reverse engineering tasks. It provides features for code rewriting, explanation, and analysis, making decompiled code more readable and identifying potential vulnerabilities.
ðŸ”— Links: â€¢ View Project ================ ðŸ”“ Open Source
